utterances.sentences: Now, there is no shortage of ideas when it comes to preventing such horror. One, we need a system that works. We once had a process for dealing with people who had a known mental illness but the process is now paralyzed by fear. People don't want to be pegged as violating someone else's rights. Today, psychiatric hospitals house less than a tenth of the people they did in the 1950's.  Yet, our population has doubled. This is some interesting facts that I've got from the journal of political economy -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb13', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb13', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.sentences: That happen the moment -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

In terms of the congressional races, gerrymandering does make a difference. That's why it's so important in terms of the governor's races -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's true.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So -- but here's the thing, I think lots of people are upset about two states in particular, Georgia and Florida, where you had two black candidates running. And I think the fear is there that the white women did not support black candidates and that they were upset about --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But also, can I say -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Why is it the person? Why can't it be the issues? Like, I can be somebody and say like, OK, so they're for Medicare for all. I'm not for that. So, if I then being racist because I don't want to vote for Medicare -- Medicare for all?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Medicare for all in Florida, if any senior paid attention.  Medicare for all means Medicare for not. They're all the bills in Washington. Get rid of Medicare as we know --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So if they voted on the issue, they wouldn't vote for somebody in favor of Medicare for all.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm sorry, that's exactly wrong. In fact, guess what, most American support this. So --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Because they don't understand it. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So most Americans thinks that it's a good idea. Most Americans want more of what people in the past called Obamacare, actually, Affordable Care Act. People want the government involved in preventing them from going bankrupt when there's some catastrophic illness.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I just don't know how much it has to do with race, Juan, because a lot of white women voted for Barack Obama in Florida twice. So I'm not so sure about that. Coming up, a radical left-wing mob targeting our own Tucker Carlson. Plus, Michael Moore says the current crop of Democrats don't stand a chance against Trump in 2020, next on The Five.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: With the midterms behind us, the spotlight now shifts to 2020.  Liberal filmmaker Michael Moore predicts a current group of potential Democratic contenders will not be able to defeat President Trump.

utterances.speaker: MICHAEL MOORE, FILMMAKER
utterances.sentences: Come up with a name. Just say the name right now.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Kamala Harris. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: MOORE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Why not?

utterances.speaker: MOORE
utterances.sentences: Love her. No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Love her?

utterances.speaker: MOORE
utterances.sentences: No. Not going to happen. Cory, love him. No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I wouldn't --

utterances.speaker: MOORE
utterances.sentences: No. It's not -- no, we cannot run a politician against him. We will lose. We have to run a beloved American. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.sentences: Yeah, patriot.

utterances.speaker: MOORE
utterances.sentences: We have to run beloved -- Obama became beloved the night of that convention and he was beloved from that moment on.

utterances.speaker: MOORE
utterances.sentences: And we need to run somebody --

utterances.speaker: MOORE
utterances.sentences: -- whether -- it's got to be like a Michelle Obama or it's got to Sully Sullenberger.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And with Democrats said to take control of the house, former speaker Newt Gingrich is warning about what can happen if they only focus on investigating President Trump.

utterances.speaker: FORMER SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE NEWT GINGRICH
utterances.sentences: If all you do is end up in investigations which unfortunately we did it '98, it actually hurts you because the country wants to see things work. I mean, the country doesn't want to have the house Democrats spend all day, every day, in investigations and in open warfare against the president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Jesse, I think that what Michael Moore is saying, you need someone with a large celebrity quotient. You know how Trump had The Apprentice and all that and the book, so what do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I agree with Michael Moore. I can't believe I'm saying that.  But he does have good political instincts. He predicted the rise of Trump.  I would not nominate the left-wing senators from the coast. They have no charisma nationally. They have no fund-raising apparatus, no policy chops.  And they're not likable people. Donald Trump, what he does with opponents is he makes them look weak. Because he's, number one, hilarious, and number two, he's so outside the box with a sharp tongue and attacks that his opponents get offended very easily. So when land blows they get offended. And they're always getting offended. And that just looks lame and it looks pathetic and it looks weak. So what they need to do, and I kind of agree with Moore here, they need to nominate someone like Alec Baldwin and here's why. He's handsome, Hollywood guy, and he doesn't care about anything. He will hit Trump back twice as hard and he has the ability to laugh Trump off. What a lot of people don't understand about Trump, you kind of have to blow him off and laugh him off.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And if you don't have to get in the dirt, you don't have to get in the dirt. Just laugh him off or hit them right between the eyes again.  But he's the only one that's authentic enough to punch back because he actually, literally, does punch back. And I think he could -- you know, he's also a little bit serious. You know, he likes policy and he loves the country. I'm saying Alec for president 2020.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So, Dagen --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: You've just gave them a playbook.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is very interesting -- you know, I never thought about Baldwin is all that handsome, but Jesse assures me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, he's gorgeous.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He's gorgeous.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: He's hot -- hot-rod.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: OK. So what about Joe Biden? Is he a hot-rod?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Joe Biden has always -- no, Joe Biden is not hot-rod. But Joe Biden has problems if you talk to anybody -- who are Democratic fund- raisers, with raising money. And that was one of the things -- he was exploring potentially taking on Hillary Clinton for the nomination. He met with some donors and he's just has trouble and -- how many times has he run for the presidency anyway? I mean, how many shots is Joe Biden going to get? But I can't wait -- what's going to happen is you're going to be what, two, three dozen people on the debate stage all trying to out-left the next one as they're going to push each other so far to the left it's going to make it really hard for whoever wins the Democratic nomination to run against Trump, because it's not going to be Medicare for all, Juan. It's going to be -- health care. We want the government running our hospitals and paying our doctors. And that's not going to fly with the American people.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think Michael Moore is trying to give them really good advice and they will not take it, all right. So he knows that rust belt part of the country very well. That is key to President Trump reelection strategy.  He only won those states by a slim margin, 78,000 votes or whatever, between Michigan, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania. He's got to re -- he's got to figure out how to do that again or he's got to find Electoral College votes elsewhere. And he's not really expanding his appeal, right? He's got his base and his Republican Party locked down. So, Michael Moore is saying we've got to find somebody who can appeal to those people in the rust belt. He's not necessarily saying that you need a moderate. I understand what he's saying. He needs somebody beloved. It's like a figure that everybody -- a person everybody knows, a hero to the Democratic Party. But I think he's also saying don't go too far left. And Gingrich is also giving them very good advice. And he's saying take it for me, I screwed up. We screwed up and we did too many investigations and it hurt us going forward.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: By the way, Biden, what do you thing? I mean, the Democrats, right now, that's their number-one pick.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think -- if I were Biden's people, I would not want to be considered the No. 1 pick right now.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Sounds like Juan likes Biden.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I'm just telling you, it's clear --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You want to be the No. 1 pick in 18 months.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's like, Biden is like 30-something percent. And the next highest is in the low teens.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You don't want to be the one at the top. That's when everyone's taking swings at you. You want to be, like, sort of mid right now.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What about this, Greg? You heard Michael Moore mention Michelle Obama, Sully Sullenberger. He didn't mention Oprah.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And then Dagen mentioned your favorite, right? But what about Michael Avenatti?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: The litigating lollipop. He's got all fire and fury, but he has no resume; and he will be in jail soon. You know what Moore was waiting for? The chorus of them to say --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "You!"

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: -- "you. Please run. Please run, or at least waddle."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: "You're describing yourself."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "You're describing yourself." And you know what? He is. The antithesis of Trump really is Michael Moore. Boisterous. I mean, he truly does look a little like Large Marge from "Pee-Wee's." But he does have the same -- he's a fighter. He knows how -- he knows how to get the base going with his movies. But just remember, they have -- the Dems will have an advantage with the media, because this next 2020, 2020 is going to be about good versus evil: the battle against evil monster Trump. So whoever they ever get, it's going to be David versus Goliath; it's going to be Gandhi versus Hitler.  Whoever they pick, the media is just going to get behind that person; and it's going to be way easy to go up against Trump. Trump's got a lot to --

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I'm looking forward to watching these Democratic candidates throw shade at each other.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Like, Hillary Clinton accused Bernie Sanders of being a sexist, quietly --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- because she talks loudly. And she made that about being a woman. But who's going to call out Elizabeth Warren for letting Harvard Law --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: -- refer to her as the first woman of color?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Kamala will. Who's going to -- who's going to share the debate questions?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, I think Republicans did a pretty good job of throwing shade, but guess what? Donald Trump is president.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He threw the most.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: He won. Only one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Chris Christie had the most shade. But Trump threw the most.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, stop. You're being mean. You're fat shaming today. Coming up -- coming up, angry protesters target our very own Tucker Carlson outside of his home. The details up next on "The Five."

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: A radical left-wing mob targeting our own Tucker Carlson. An angry group of criminal Antifa protesters showed up outside his home last night, the crowd chanting threats against him and his family. They vandalized his property. Tucker wasn't home at the time, but his wife was. When the group started banging on his front door, she hid in the pantry, called 911, thinking that she was about to be a victim of a home invasion.  D.C. Police are now investigating the incident as a hate crime. Dana, there are a lot more details in this. Apparently, there was one protester caught mentioning a pipe bomb among other details, and the front door being broken.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Having known, a lot of us -- all of us know Tucker and Susie, who is one of the most wonderful women. To imagine in your mind's eye what it was like for her, how scary that might have been; and to hide in your home and to not know what was happening. And I understand that his brother was there pretty quickly. These people are such cowards. It is -- it's distressing. And I know that if it was the other way around, that somebody on the left that had a talk show had this happen to them at their House, Tucker Carlson would be the first to defend them and defend them strongly. And hopefully, other people well. I do want to mention that FOX News, the CEO, Suzanne Scott, and the president, Jay Wallace, put out a statement saying how reprehensible it was. And that "We as a nation have become far too intolerant of different points of view and that recent events across our country clearly highlight the need for a more civil, respectful and inclusive national conversation."  And they say also that "Those of us in the media and in politics bear a special obligation to all Americans to find common ground." That was their statement today.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: How do you put a stop to it, though?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, I think it was Kilmeade, because his book got knocked off by -- You know, here's the thing. You can't tell your followers to confront people and get in their faces. I am glad that other talk show hosts actually have come out and said this is bad. But I do think -- I do think one way to tamp down all of this is for everybody to put politics back in the box where it belongs. We have let -- we are letting people dictate where politics can go. To restaurants, to entertainment, movies, television. The one thing is I can say that Juan and I can agree: politics is not part of your family. It's not part of this. But the people in the street that were at Tucker's House, they're never going to listen to us, because they don't have a life. Their life is this.  Their life is antagonism. So we can say we've got to tamp this down and be calm, but it's going to fall on deaf ears, sadly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think a lot of it is a rage. And so people get incited and they decide they're going to take it in their own hands. And so even though we may be having a legitimate argument or debate here on FOX or any cable station, I think there are people who then get over the -- over themselves, you know, overly excited and then become threatening and think it's legitimate to go to someone's House. Well, how illegitimate. How ineffective. In fact, it has the contrary effect. I think it gives people who support whatever you don't like about what Tucker is saying, it gives them ammunition then to redouble and to feel some moral superiority to you as the protester. And I think it's so key that other people in our business have rallied to Tucker's side. And remember: not everybody agrees with Tucker. But here, keep this in mind. Don Lemon, somebody was arrested, an Arkansas man, for dozens of threats against Don Lemon. Don Lemon and Tucker Carlson couldn't be more opposite on issues like diversity and immigration, but what do you see? Now they have something in common, which is common indecency of people threatening you, because you're on television making a statement. By the way, I get this. I'll tell you, I don't like death threats, and I've seen them from both sides. I don't like it. I don't like being trolled. I don't like being attacked. My books, my writing, I can't stand it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: But this --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But I just think this is where we have gone as a country. And this moment with Tucker is a moment that we need to seriously absorb and know that this is the time to stop, especially before we get into the 2020 cycle.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, Hillary said the resistance would stop being so uncivil once they won the House. I guess these people never got that memo. There's two things going on here. One, the state of activism in America today. There's no huge civil rights struggle. There's no draft. There's nothing that threatening going on in American society. The economy is humming. So the people that have that resistance in their blood, those people that are born to march the streets, what are they marching for?  What are they marching against? They really don't have anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Against a talk show host.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Think about it. We love Tucker. Very talented guy. He is a talk show host on cable. He is not the leader of a mass armed resistance that's taking away everybody's rights. So let's just put it in perspective. The other thing going on here is this. When you're surrounding someone's homes, you've lost the intellectual argument. Tucker Carlson makes pretty well-thought-out intellectual arguments about immigration, about tearing down monuments, about trade, political correctness. And he does it in a very thoughtful way. The people that disagree with him can't make that intellectual arguments, so what they do, they're reduced to surrounding his house and chanting.  And that is so uncivilized in this country. We don't live in the dark ages where you rush a house with a pitchfork. These people should man up, stop being such infantile --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: They should be arrested, too.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- people. And actually, if you disagree with someone, there's avenues and institutions in this country where you could get heard.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Dana made the point: you arrest them, you charge them and you throw them in prison, period. By the way, Kilmeade, he's hosting "Carlson" tonight.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know, I know.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: But Tucker --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Do you think that was a coincidence?

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Tucker -- to be clear, to be clear, Tucker had a scheduled evening off.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: He's going to be calling in, so I've been told.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Excellent.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So you must tune in. Up next, it's "Wild Card Wednesday," on Thursday. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dagen likes the country music. Thank you, Dagen, for dancing there. Welcome back. It's been a busy week, so we move to "Wild Card Wednesday" today, Thursday.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Wild Card Wednesday

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: There it is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, look at that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So we each take a topic and put them in this hat. None of us know the stories each other picked. So I get to pull them out of a hat. I haven't even cheated this time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Good for you, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So I don't know what it is. Let's see. Coffee stores implement 16-year-age restriction for buying caffeinated drinks.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was mine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's yours. Why do you think that's a good idea?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I didn't think they -- they didn't impose it. What happened was that they denied a 12-year-old girl a cup of coffee. Her dad then said, "What is it about? Why can't my daughter get --?" And they said, "We don't serve people under 16." So to my mind, that was, like, hmm. That's really interesting. In this country -- that, by the way, this took place in England.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, of course.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And -- but in this country, we say you can't have cigarettes or alcohol.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's different, Juan. I want kids hopped up on coffee.  They do their chores much faster. Seriously.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Cheaper labor.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And they get real wound up and then they go to bed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But the first -- then they start having coffee, and then "I'm going to have a cigarette." It's a coffee and cigarette break. They're out in front of the house.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a gateway drug.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They're out in front of the house for their work -- their lunch break.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I can -- just as a warning to teenagers and adults alike that, if you drink too much coffee, you can easily develop a facial twitch.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Which happened to me when I first started working here.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No way.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I was drinking so much coffee. and I was doing this on the air.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I thought you were flirting with me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But the other thing is, they don't let them have energy drinks.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Communists.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Communists.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it is the U.K. There are a lot of rules there. That's why I had to leave. OK, next one is, woman finds basic engagement ring before boyfriend proposes, and she complained about it online. She called it "basic A.F."  And Comfortably Smug (ph) one time had to tell me what "A.F." meant. She's -- but she's got blowback, because she's complaining. And people online are saying --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How much was the ring?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, but -- but maybe that's all he can afford. She shouldn't, like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Save up, bro.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: She actually said -- posted online not only the photo. This is my story.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: What a mistake.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: That "Tell me how to tactfully say no, you need to go get something different." I'm probably the only person at this table who has actually sold my divorced husband's -- my engagement ring on eBay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: So I will say this. This dude is doing it right. The only way to make this ring better is if it's not even diamonds. If it was, like, cubic zirconia. This is the worst investment ever.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Exactly. Save up for a home.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.sentences: This is advice.

utterances.sentences: Don't --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.sentences: Let me go to another one. College students save space to destress from midterm election results. Come on, kids. utterances.sentences: So 18 is the new 8.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

Now I'm thinking if I was in college, and I got, like, a little safe space to chill and have no classes, I'd be like, "Yes, this midterm is stressing me out. I need to skip it." I'm all for it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Well, we have --

utterances.sentences: No. Normally, you talk about your mom, but I think your dad, I'm going to speak for your dad right now. "I'm paying for you to go to school, not to have chill-out sessions." All right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That is true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, and that's -- all right. A 69-year-old dutchman starts a legal bid to become 20 years younger. Greg, why did you choose this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.sentences: -- or who you see yourself. Rachel Dolezal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.sentences: Changed her race, right? Change your height. You can say -- I can say that there are people who are actually identifying as animals now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, jeez.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you can look it up. And so -- you can't argue with them, because "It's my identity." So he's identifying as a person 20 years younger.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.sentences: And you don't get --

utterances.sentences: And your Social Security is 20 years away now.

utterances.sentences: But he said he wanted to do it to improve his chances with women on dating apps and help with job prospects.

utterances.sentences: To lie.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, you're defending this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I've noticed I've been discriminated against once I hit 40. It's true. I'm not getting the same opportunities I got in my 30s.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: But then you -- but then you got the hairpiece and everything.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I told you that in confidence.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse, we could send you back out on the road. And we could -- you want those opportunities?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes, "Watters' World" gets back out there. Did someone say spring break?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, so OK. And we don't get to talk about it, but mine was about a 7-foot alligator.  Do we have time? OK, so the owner of a 7-foot alligator is upset because animal control officers came and took him away. And he said, "No, he's like a dog."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's a crock.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, good one!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But guess what?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's a therapy support alligator.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But guess what? They also found two boa constrictors and a rabbit. But I'm thinking that the rabbit was --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was launch.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, exactly, for the boa constrictors.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, and you know what struck me about that story: the alligator was in a hot tub.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Oh, God.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: He must have been having a great time.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't ever do that, trust me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Was this Florida? In Florida?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Kansas City.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Weekend in Mexico, I'll never forget it.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Being a redneck, I can tell you, alligators prefer chickens over rabbits. And the rabbit was in the other room. It wasn't near the animals that would eat it. That's why it's still alive.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I mean, just rescue a dog. Great. "One More Thing" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Greg's Robot News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Greg's Robot News." All right, man. There's some good news and bad news. The National Institute of Industrial Science and Technology has created a humanoid robot that can do construction. So it seems like construction workers are now under threat. This is a constructor who's actually installing drywall by itself.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Really moving slow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: So the negative side to this, Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It takes 20 years to get the house built.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I know. It takes forever. The down side is it could replace jobs, but the upside: no plumber's crack.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That really is an upside.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's an upside, believe me.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And I was worried about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've seen enough of it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So I want to see if anything here will feel like they're unambitious or lazy when I tell you this story. Thirty-one-year-old Pete Kostelnik just finished his 5,400-mile Ke2Key run.  Pete is an ultra-marathon runner. He started his journey on July 31 in Anchor Point on Alaska's Kenai Peninsula. He finishes Monday in Florida's Key West. He averaged 55 miles a day for 97 days, kept all of his supplies in that stroller there. There's no baby in there. He says that he hopes his feet would inspire others to chase their dreams, as well. And in 2016, Pete ran 3,067 miles from San Francisco to New York City. So he's running a lot.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Doesn't he know there's Amtrak?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That would make sense.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: All right. So get-well wishes tonight for Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. The 85-year-old fell at the court yesterday. She fractured three ribs. After a night at home, she's been admitted to George Washington Hospital for observation. You know she's the oldest member of the high court. Her current illness is the latest in a long line. She's been through two bouts of cancer and had a heart stent implanted. Ginsburg keeps going, though. She hasn't missed a day of oral arguments and selected clerks to work with her through 2020. Of course, political speculation about her health, will Donald Trump have a third nomination to the court? I say let's leave politics aside and just say get well to the Notorious RBG.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: I'm going to get you a "Keep Planking, RBG" T-shirt, because she's notorious for her yoga workouts. So there you go. That will be your Christmas gift.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. I'm going to do my Juan imitation. If you thought your commute was bad, check this video out. Here's a wild boar attacking a Japanese man during his morning commute. The guy was walking to the local train station when all of a sudden, wham!  A wild boar takes him out at the knees and then goes after his briefcase.  The pig also bit the guy and bored him with his tusks. Southern island of Kyushu Fuku (ph). It turns out the train station is about half a mile from a mountainous area. Authorities think the boar accidentally ran through the town. The man was hospitalized, needing a total of 13 stitches.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God. It's good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- along -- on his left thigh.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think your imitation of me is better than the story.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: This story is not boar-ing.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You like that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I like that. I can't get over it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That's probably your best "One More Thing" ever.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That was great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Please keep that for the Christmas show.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Dana.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: Thank you for teeing up my "One More Thing." Christmas sweaters, Miller Lite. It's a perfect combination. They released their ugly sweater for the 2018 holidays.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Greg, you need that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: And then you can also get socks or a hat with a little pom-pom.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It's not that ugly.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: The dress socks are less than --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, I've seen worse. I have worse.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That one's pretty ugly.

utterances.speaker: MCDOWELL
utterances.sentences: But I need a chin strap on the hat to carry my beer.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: This person never wears an ugly Christmas sweater. It's "Special Report" up next, Bret Baier. Hey, Bret. How's it going.

utterances.speaker: BRET BAIER, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: I have a couple of them. Thanks, Greg. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
